author: Adam Savage’s Tested
description:
The National Park Service was founded in 1916, so how is the first badge from 1895? At the National Park Service Museum Conservation Lab, museum curator Casey Oehler walks Adam Savage through a selection of the 240 badges in NPS' collection, and explains how she and her team use an XRF Spectrometer as part of their research and chronicling of each.

National Park Museum Conservation Lab: https://www.nps.gov/subjects/hfc/museum-conservation-services.htm
National Park Service: https://www.nps.gov/index.htm
What Happens When Taxidermy Fails: https://youtu.be/_ovkiZfl9aw
Where America’s Historical Artifacts Are Being Preserved (Well ... For Now): https://youtu.be/1lxSXvLGvcs
How to Wash a 157-Year-Old Newspaper: https://youtu.be/P3J-ToojchA
Adam Savage Learns How Noiseless Typewriters Work! https://youtu.be/lswxgfgV1EA
Restoring a Bald Eagle When Its Feathers Are Illegal: https://youtu.be/ZQv9Knuj2Tk
More Tested/NPS Videos: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P3J-ToojchA&list=PLJtitKU0CAej3Az
title: A Fascinating History of NPS Badges (Including the FIRST EVER!)
